lender.name: Claire
lender.loan_because: A few years ago my friend asked her grandfather to make a slingshot for me as a gift. You're probably wondering how old I am to have enjoyed such a thing. Let's just say I'm young enough at heart to think a slingshot is awesome! A few month's ago I asked my friend's grandfather to make a slingshot for my nephew on his 9th Birthday (a slightly more "appropriate" age). Instead of accepting payment for the labor, my friend's grandfather asked me to donate the money to a benevolence of our choice. I got together with my nephew and explained kiva to him. Using a lemonade stand as an example, I managed to get the point across (I hope). My desire is that that slingshot will become more than a gift to my nephew and will impact others across the world. And I hope this will be a lesson to my nephew of the needs of others, the importance of giving, and that the world is bigger than his backyard.

lender.name: Dr. Rich Day
lender.occupational_info: In 2001 my son Eric was born. Within a week he began crying almost non-stop. He cried most of the day and most of the night and this went on for nearly 6 months. My wife and I weren't getting any sleep either. We saw a pediatrician and neurologist, and none of them were able to help my son. A friend asked if we'd tried chiropractic. "Chiropractic?", I thought. "Why in the world would I take my child to a chiropractor? He doesn't have a bad back?". We ended up taking Eric to a local chiropractor and within 2 weeks my son was sleeping through the night. Around this same time I was laid off from my job, and my son's experience with chiropractic set my life on a course. I went back to school at the University of Colorado for my pre-med courses and earned my Doctorate of Chiropractic in Kansas City. Today, my wife (who is also a chiropractor) and I devote ourselves to the health and wellness of, not just children, but entire families in our community.
